Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where they want, even if for debate purposes-- yet they don't like it when foreigners patrol their turf in violation of their own rules. They apparently feel that because they're Americans, visiting in another country, this opens up an privileged first class 'rights' card.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful at times.
Throughout this hybrid drama there seems to be no clear idea whether to focus on their war against British settlers or the attack against other Maori warriors to protect a young girl’s whaka (spirit).
